channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Macy’s and Target Reports Show Consumers Are Still Bargain Shopping
item.description: Department store chains have struggled as Americans, squeezed by budget constraints, spend less time and money at their stores.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel and Hezbollah Exchange Strikes Amid Fears of Escalation
item.description: The Israeli military said it had hit weapons facilities, prompting Hezbollah to target an Israeli base, as tit-for-tat strikes continued across the Le...

item.title: Starbucks is so desperate for sales it’s pulling out the big guns—the pumpkin spice latte—earlier than ever before
item.description: The fall product lineup is taking on extra weight after the coffee chain jettisoned its CEO in a surprise shake-up.

item.title: Trump Isn’t Finished
item.description: The damage inflicted on the nation during the former president’s first term in office pales in comparison to what he will do if he is elected to a sec...

item.title: ‘Keyboard Warriors’ Who Stoked UK Riots Test the Limits of Free Speech
item.description: As hundreds of people appear in court for their role in recent anti-immigrant riots in Britain, several are accused of fueling disorder through online...

item.title: Homeowners are delaying DIY renovations and it’s hammering the home improvement industry
item.description: Lowe’s and Home Depot both lowered sales growth predictions as fewer shoppers commit to renovation projects.

item.title: Al Attles, a Golden State Warrior in Name and in Spirit, Dies at 87
item.description: He was known as the Destroyer for his gritty intensity as a player. He later coached Golden State to an N.B.A. championship and served as its general ...

item.title: Four Bodies From Bayesian Yacht Found in Sicily
item.description: The discoveries came after the vessel went down this week in what some witnesses described as a waterspout, or a small tornado, during a violent downp...

item.title: The U.S. dollar is weakening because some investors think Kamala Harris will win
item.description: The dollar should be relatively strong, yet it’s close to its 2024 low.

item.title: How Costco Hacked the American Shopping Psyche
item.description: More than 100 million people visit the retailer for their groceries — and gas and TVs and gold bars and pet coffins — but saving money may not be the ...

item.title: New Study Re-Evaluates ‘Worst Case’ Scenario for Thwaites Glacier
item.description: Global warming is putting the continent’s ice at risk of destruction in many forms. But one especially calamitous scenario might be a less pressing co...

item.title: That huge negative revision to job growth frightened some investors but most experts aren’t worried
item.description: Yardeni Research’s Eric Wallerstein said the revision is “kind of a nothing burger.”

item.title: Fed Minutes Show a Cut ‘Likely’ to Come in September
item.description: Even before a disappointing July jobs report, Federal Reserve officials thought they would probably cut rates at their Sept. 17-18 meeting.

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis Protest Conscription at Draft Center in Jerusalem
item.description: Protests over military conscription highlight the rising tensions surrounding a court order overturning a decades-long exemption for the religious com...

item.title: Investors pulled nearly $0.5 trillion in 2020’s market turbulence—then missed the rally
item.description: “If you buy high and sell low, your return will lag the buy-and-hold return.”
